intro: Eugenia rinconiensis, commonly known as the Rincón guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and red, edible berries that are similar to guavas. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a glossy appearance, contributing to its ornamental value.
